metadata.Title: CVE-2020-10663 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The JSON gem through 2.2.0 for Ruby, as used in Ruby 2.4 through 2.4.9, 2.5 through 2.5.7, and 2.6 through 2.6.5, has an Unsafe Object Creation Vulnerability. This is quite similar to CVE-2013-0269, but does not rely on poor garbage-collection behavior within Ruby. Specifically, use of JSON parsing methods can lead to creation of a malicious object within the interpreter, with adverse effects that are application-dependent.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10663` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby2.5 - 2.5.1-1ubuntu1.8
ruby2.5 - 2.5.1-1ubuntu1.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby-json: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
ruby2.5 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.5.1-1ubuntu1.8').
